qas.question: What trend has Egypt healthcare made recently?
How much of ppopulation can be covered by immunization programs?
What was the life expectancy in 2009?
What direction has infant mortality rate taken?

context: As a result of modernisation efforts over the years, Egypt's healthcare system has made <a0_0>great strides forward<a0_0/>. Access to healthcare in both urban and rural areas greatly improved and immunisation programs are now able to cover <a1_0>98%<a1_0/> of the population. Life expectancy increased from <a2_0>44.8 years<a2_0/> during the 1960s to <a3_0>72.12 years<a3_0/> in 2009. There was a <a4_0>noticeable decline<a4_0/> of the infant mortality rate (during the 1970s to the 1980s the infant mortality rate was 101-132/1000 live births, in 2000 the rate was 50-60/1000, and in 2008 it was 28-30/1000).
